info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 07 at 7:44PM MST until January 09 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ MONDAY TO 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Northerly winds sustained at 25 to 45 mph with gusts as high as 55 to 65 mph. * WHERE...In Colorado, Cheyenne and Kit Carson counties. In Kansas, Cheyenne, Rawlins, Decatur, Norton, Sherman, Thomas, Sheridan, Graham, Wallace, Logan, Gove, Greeley and Wichita counties. In Nebraska, Hitchcock and Red Willow counties. * WHEN...From 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Monday to 5 AM MST /6 AM CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous or impossible travel conditions. Road closures are likely. This includes the Interstate 70 corridor in northwest Kansas and far eastern Colorado. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snow will rapidly develop across the warning area early Monday morning. Conditions will rapidly deteriorate around, or shortly after, sunrise. Heavy snow will persist throughout the day, tapering off from west to east late Monday night. Blowing snow will persist after precipitation ends. Conditions may not substantially improve until after sunrise Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
